intro: Rhacoma oxyphylla, commonly known as the red-flowered rhacoma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a leathery texture. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and birds. Rhacoma oxyphylla is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
